quest.name: Of Defectors and Defenders
journal: Radovan and Sophie's expressions are as somber as their surroundings.

Sophie and Radovan were recently confronted with the harsh realities of life in Ishgard when they witnessed the frozen corpse of a homeless man being carried past. Moved by the plight of those affected by such adverse conditions, your comrades asked the Temple Knights if they could provide assistance and were directed to speak with a man named Reese, a member of Garlond Ironworks. Radovan tells you that their founder, Cid, is regarded as a hero by many living under Garlean rule, and he sees it as a great honor to be associated with his organization.

Reese reveals the plan to help a renowned Garlean scientist defect from the Empire. Upon his arrival in Ishgard, he is to oversee the installation of a ceruleum heating system to help alleviate the woes of the citizenry, particularly those most exposed to the cold. However, he is pursued by the Alaudae, imperial convicts who carry out missions to reduce their sentences. The leader, Vitus quo Messalla, was relegated from pilus prior for slaughtering civilians and assigned with handpicking conscripts for the Alaudae. Radovan was one such candidate, though he refused─and was summarily tortured for it. Now that Radovan is faced with the prospect of going toe-to-toe with his former tormentor, he tells Sophie not to participate in this mission, implying that she would be a burden to him. After she storms off, Radovan admits that this was a ploy to have her stay out of harm's way, as she is the closest thing he has to family and he could not bear to lose her. You make your way to the Observatorium to commence the assignment, while Sophie remains in Ishgard.

You reach the top of the Observatorium, where you are introduced to the Garlean scientist Cato nan Mammula. Although you and Reese notice Radovan react strangely upon hearing this name, you choose not to press him on the matter, as time is of the essence. Once the group has descended the tower, they prepare to make the first leg of the journey, with Camp Dragonhead as their next destination.

Radovan and your clients have barely stepped foot outside the camp gates before being attacked by one of the Alaudae, who now lies at Radovan's feet, cut down by his gunblade. Now that they have discovered your location, they will stop at nothing to seize Mammula. Any number of pursuers may have hidden themselves in the snow between the Observatorium and Camp Dragonhead, so Radovan sends you ahead to lure them into the open.

As Radovan predicted, the Alaudae had sent several units of ruthless killers to bar your way. One by one they fall to your gunblade until you finally reach Camp Dragonhead, where you await the arrival of Radovan, Reese, and Mammula.

The remainder of your party finally reaches the safety of the camp, although not without incident, as Reese has been wounded by the Alaudae. Fearing that an encounter with Vitus quo Messalla is all but assured, Radovan opts to avoid combat altogether and take Mammula to the Gates of Judgement without being seen by the enemy, leaving you and Reese behind to reduce the risk of detection. Shortly after they depart, Sophie appears out of the blue, saying that she came looking for you and Radovan since you had been gone much longer than she had expected. When you apprise her of the situation, she is shocked to hear the name Cato nan Mammula, as he and Midas nan Garlond were responsible for the failed experiment that destroyed Bozja Citadel─Radovan's home. It dawns on her that Radovan may attempt to exact his vengeance on the Garlean scientist and she beseeches you to find her companion before he can execute his plan.

Radovan is poised to slay Mammula, who appears to have accepted his fate. You implore the gunbreaker to lay down his weapon, reminding him that he gave his word to deliver the Garlean defector from harm. The rage that had threatened to consume Radovan subsides, and he turns to leave, seeking solitude so that he may contemplate his actions. By the time Sophie arrives, he is long gone, and she takes command of the mission, leading the way back to Ishgard.

Reese and Mammula express their thanks for seeing the assignment through to the end, in spite of the numerous difficulties faced, both expected and otherwise. However, even within the walls of Ishgard, the threat of the Alaudae remains, necessitating Garlond Ironworks to keep Mammula in a secure location until they can be sure the danger has passed. Meanwhile, there is still no sign of Radovan, so Sophie decides to wait for him to come to his senses and return to Ishgard.
objectives: Speak with Reese at the Observatorium.
Speak with Radovan outside the Observatorium.
Survey the designated locations and defeat the Alaudae.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: I'll say one thing for Ishgardians: they certainly know how to dress. Not only do their clothes keep out the cold─well, most of it─they are surprisingly elegant.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We Hrothgar are quite used to snow and ice, so we sometimes forget the problems it poses for other races. This morning, a homeless Hyur lad was found lying stone cold in the street.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: When they came to carry him away, he was frozen solid, like a statue. The poor thing can't have been more than twenty summers old.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We asked the Temple Knights if there was something we could do, and we were told that they had the perfect assignment for us. Our client this time is Reese of Garlond Ironworks.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Their founder, Cid Garlond, is one of the few Garleans to have turned his back on the Empire and is a hero to many living under their rule. I wonder if I might have the honor of meeting him in person? At any rate, we must first head to the Skysteel Manufactory.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: So, this is one of Cid Garlond's workshops?

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Is it true that Cid is the one who introduced magitek to Eorzea?

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorningday. I take it you're the bodyguards sent by the Temple Knights? There's someone I'd like you to protect. A recently defected Garlean engineer, as it happens.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: I'll not bore you with the details, but he is to oversee the installation of a ceruleum heating system. We're hoping it would avert tragedies like the one that recently occurred in the Brume.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Yes, we saw the body being carried away. Terrible sight, it was. If this engineer friend of yours needs safe passage here, we'd be glad to help.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the Empire does not take kindly to desertion, especially when the man in question is one of its most highly esteemed scientists. We've received word that a group known as the “Alaudae” has been dispatched to see that he never reaches Ishgard.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Gods be good!

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: I've heard of them. Prisoners offered an “opportunity” to reduce their sentences through loyal service to Garlemald. By all accounts, they fight like men possessed, desperate to earn their freedom.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Worst of all, they are led by Vitus quo Messalla, a man whose cruelty knows no bounds.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: As a soldier, he reached the rank of pilus prior but was relegated after butchering a village of innocent civilians, purely to sate his own bloodlust.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Even his fellow Garleans were disgusted by these barbaric acts, yet that did naught to damage his reputation as a skilled warrior equal to Gaius van Baelsar himself.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: During my imprisonment, Vitus quo Messalla came to enlist me. I told him I'd sooner rot in gaol than serve under a rabid dog like him.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: As you can imagine, he was far from pleased with my refusal, and tried to “persuade” me by using my magitek collar to administer countless electric shocks. I'll never forget the look in his eyes as he pushed that button over and over.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Of course, not everyone is as resilient as Radovan. Many who fight for the Alaudae do so against their will, though they are no less deadly for it.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: By the Fury! If I'd known the dangers involved, I would have called the whole thing off.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: It's too late now, though. The airship is already on its way to Coerthas! It should soon be arriving at the Observatorium. Sadly, we couldn't gain permission to have an imperial craft dock in the city for matters of security.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: From the rendezvous point, we'll proceed the rest of the way on foot. Once we're safely inside the Gates of Judgement, we can consider the mission a success.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Your friend is risking his life for the sake of others. Reese, I give my word that he will reach Ishgard safely.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Listen, Sophie. You know as well as I do that the Alaudae are as ruthless as they are tenacious. For that reason, I want you to stay behind.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: You think you can take them on without me there to heal you?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Don't get me wrong, I'm grateful to have you by my side. But against foes like that, Forename and I will struggle to protect you and the engineer.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Protect me!? Look, Radovan, we protect each other, remember? Or perhaps you see me as nothing but a burden!? Fine! Have it your way!

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Umm... Not to rush you or anything, but we should get going. I'll meet you at the airship landing on top of the tower.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Before we leave, there's something I'd like to make clear. I didn't mean what I said to Sophie. I think she's an excellent conjurer and more than capable of taking care of herself.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: But this is Vitus quo Messalla we're dealing with, a monster who delights in toying with his prey. I can't let her face that kind of danger.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: You see, Sophie and I have been inseparable ever since we escaped our Garlean captors. When I discovered what had befallen my family, I came close to taking my own life, and I might have even gone through with it if Sophie hadn't stopped me.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: She's lost loved ones too, but has never given up hope. Sophie helped me realize there is still a place in this world for me. In fact, it was her idea that I become a bodyguard.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Although no one will ever replace the family I lost, she helped fill that void in my life and gave me a reason to carry on.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Hah! If she were here now, she would tell me to stop being such a sentimental old fool, or words to that effect. Anyway, the sooner we finish this assignment, the sooner I can get back here and apologize to her.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: I get the impression they've been waiting for us. Perhaps I spoke overlong?

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Now that you're here, allow me to introduce the man you will be escorting.

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: Cato nan Mammula, at your service. Or should that be Cato Mammula now that I am in Ishgard?

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: No, it's nothing.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Ahem. Master Mammula is carrying documents liberated from the Empire that could prove vital in Garlond Ironworks' investigation of Omega. This may lead to an increased likelihood of encountering imperial pursuers, however.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Well then, shall we begin?

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: They've found us!

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: That's the way! Give them what for!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: The Alaudae knew we were coming. Hells' bells, they must've seen that airship from malms away!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: I'll stay with the engineer. You go on ahead and draw them out. We'll rendezvous at the camp to the north.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: There isn't much cover, but they could be hiding in the snow.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: This one's mine!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: First the guards, then the target!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: This is as far as you go!

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry... They caught me by surprise.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Some of the Alaudae stayed in their hiding places until you'd passed. One of them got to Reese. He's hurt, but it could've been a lot worse.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We've made it this far, but Vitus is still out there.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: If this is just a taste of what the Alaudae have in store for us, our best option is to avoid confrontation altogether. Mammula and I will sneak past them while you and Reese stay behind. The two of us stand a better chance than a group of four.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No, we should stick together!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Take care of Mammula.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: I know how you feel, but sometimes discretion is the better part of valor. You see the sense in this, don't you?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: We'll meet back in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: My colleagues will contact me via linkpearl once Master Mammula has arrived in Ishgard. In the meantime, we should lie low. We don't want to alert the Alaudae to our presence any more than we already have. Oh, and I'd better get these wounds looked at.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Thank goodness you're all right! You'd been gone so long, I came looking for you. I met a few nasty characters on the way here, but I soon sent them packing.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Wait─where's Radovan? And that engineer you're supposed to be escorting?

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Cato nan Mammula!?

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: If the two of them are together, then...

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Radovan never talks to anyone about it, but he comes from a place called Bozja Citadel. It was utterly destroyed in a Garlean experiment gone wrong.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: In charge of the project were Midas nan Garlond and his right-hand man, Cato nan Mammula.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Radovan's opposition to Bozja being used as a testing ground for potentially dangerous magitek led to his imprisonment, and his fears were proved correct when the city was obliterated.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: There's a strong chance that he's planning to exact his revenge.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: We have to stop him!

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: They headed west towards Ishgard, yes? We should be able to follow their tracks. There's no time to lose!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: For my homeland. For my family!

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: Bozja...

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Forename!?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Stay back! This fiend robbed me of everything I held dear!

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: Don't deny me my vengeance!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: But he's unarmed!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You swore to protect him!

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: I will not beg your forgiveness. However, I ask that you hear my final words.

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: Midas and I knew there were risks involved with the experiment, but we did not foresee that it could fail so catastrophically! I have lived with unending, agonizing guilt ever since.

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: From that day forth, I have sought redemption, a chance to somehow right the wrongs I have committed.

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: That is why I asked Midas's son, Cid, to aid in my defection from Garlemald, that my knowledge and expertise may be put to good use.

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: But I always knew that the sins of my past would return to haunt me. I submit myself to your judgment.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Does the word of a gunbreaker mean nothing!?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten about Guldweitz!?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: What have I become?

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: My honor as a gunbreaker...as a man. I've thrown it all away.

dialogue.name: RADOVAN
dialogue.text: You are the last of us now.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03265
dialogue.text: Y-You want us to kill him now, sir?

dialogue.name: VITUSQUOMESSALLA
dialogue.text: (-Commanding Officer-)No. The old goat can wait.

dialogue.name: VITUSQUOMESSALLA
dialogue.text: (-Commanding Officer-)It's the prowling lion I want. Yes...your head will make a fine trophy.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Is Mammula all right? And where's Radovan!?

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Wandered off!? But we've still got a job to do!

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: And I dread to think what might've happened if you hadn't stopped him.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Come on, Forename. With or without Radovan, we still have a job to do. Let's get Mammula to Ishgard.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: I noticed that Radovan acted rather strangely when he first met Master Mammula, but I had no idea he'd try to kill him! Thank goodness for you and Sophie!

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: I shall not squander this second chance at life. You have my eternal gratitude.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: After the trouble you had reaching Camp Dragonhead, I'm pleasantly surprised that the Alaudae kept away from us for the remainder of the journey.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: Yes, fortunate indeed. All's well that ends well, as the saying goes.

dialogue.name: RESSE
dialogue.text: One thing still troubles me, though. If that Vitus quo Messalla is as ruthless as you say, I doubt the walls of Ishgard will deter him from pursuing his target. As such, Master Mammula will be closely guarded until we can be certain it's safe.

dialogue.name: CATONANMAMMULA
dialogue.text: Yes, it would be a shame if I were kept from fulfilling my obligations. I hope that the next time we meet, I shall have glad tidings to share.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: We managed to get Mammula here unharmed, but in doing so, we've lost sight of Radovan. He could be anywhere by now.

dialogue.name: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: But we've been through too much for me to turn my back on him now. If he decides to get his act together, he knows where to find me. Until then, we'd better be on the lookout for the Alaudae. I doubt we've seen the last of them.
